first_two_sentences: David noticed he had put on a lot of weight recently. He examined his habits to try and figure out the reason.
sentence5: After a few weeks, he started to feel much better.

first_two_sentences: Tom had a very short temper. One day a guest made him very angry.
sentence5: Tom sat on his couch filled with regret about his actions.

first_two_sentences: Marcus needed clothing for a business casual event. All of his clothes were either too formal or too casual.
sentence5: Marcus was happy to have the right clothes for the event.

first_two_sentences: Bobby thought Bill should buy a trailer and haul it with his car. Bill thought a truck would be better for what he needed.
sentence5: He ended up buying the truck he wanted despite Bobby's advice.

first_two_sentences: John was a pastor with a very bad memory. He tried to memorize his sermons many days in advance but to no avail.
sentence5: His congregation was delighted and so was he.

first_two_sentences: Melody's parents surprised her with a trip to the big aquarium. Melody took a nap during the two hour car ride to the aquarium.
sentence5: After five hours at the aquarium, Melody and her family drove home.

first_two_sentences: The math teacher announced a pop quiz as class began. While some students complained, he began passing out the quiz.
sentence5: I stood up feeling confident and turned it in.

first_two_sentences: My first girlfriend i met on the internet. She lives about 4 hours away from me.
sentence5: We decided we couldn't be apart so she moved in with me.

first_two_sentences: I got Charlie Horse when I was four years old. He's a brown stuffed horse, and at 35 I still sleep with him at night.
sentence5: I liked to listen to my radio as I fell asleep cuddling him.

first_two_sentences: Laura loved corn. So she decided to grow some in her backyard.
sentence5: So Laura quickly abandoned her corn garden idea.
